query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Ruppemi l’alto sonno ne la testa 2 un greve truono, sì ch’io mi riscossi 3 come persona ch’è per forza desta;
query.error: **English:** 1 A loud clap of thunder broke my deep sleep, 2 so that I started up 3 like a person who is forcibly awakened;
query.result: 1 Wearð me ðæs slæpes swutol on heafde 2 ðunor on lyfte, ða ic onwoc hrade 3 swa ðegn byð on fyrde ðonne he gefricgeð

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 e l’occhio riposato intorno mossi, 5 dritto levato, e fiso riguardai 6 per conoscer lo loco dov’ io fossi.
query.error: **English:** 4 and with my rested eyes I looked around, 5 standing up straight and gazing intently 6 to find out where I was.
query.result: 4 hlude hlemm on here, scearpne ord scritman 5 wigend weccean, and ða wulf hleoðoð 6 yrre on ðære nihte, norðan winda

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Vero è che ’n su la proda mi trovai 8 de la valle d’abisso dolorosa 9 che ’ntrono accoglie d’infiniti guai.
query.error: **English:** 7 It is true that I found myself on the edge 8 of the dolorous valley of the abyss, 9 which gathers within it infinite woes.
query.result: 7 Soð is ðæt ic me fand on ðære strande 8 ðære earmlican deopan dales, 9 ðe on hire fæðme unrim gerîmes hæfð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Oscura e profonda era e nebulosa 11 tanto che, per ficcar lo viso a fondo, 12 io non vi discernea alcuna cosa.
query.error: **English:** 10 Dark and deep and cloudy it was, 11 so much that, peering into its depths, 12 I could not make out anything.
query.result: 10 Dim wæs and deop and ðuster ðær, 11 swa ðæt ðæs leoman ne meahte on ðam grund 12 geseon hwæt ðær wæs innan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 «Or discendiam qua giù nel cieco mondo», 14 cominciò il poeta tutto smorto. 15 «Io sarò primo, e tu sarai secondo».
query.result:
**English:**
13 "Now let us descend down here into the blind world," 14 began the poet, all pale. 15 "I will be first, and you will be second."
**Old English:**
13 "Nu wuton we nider astigon on ðone wonnan grund," 14 ongan ða se scop sprecan, eal swa he dead wære. 15 "Ic wille beon forma, and ðu scealt beon æfter."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 E io, che del color mi fui accorto, 17 dissi: «Come verrò, se tu paventi 18 che suoli al mio dubbiare esser conforto?».
query.error: **English:** 16 And I, who had noticed my color, 17 said: "How shall I come, if you are afraid, 18 you who are accustomed to be a comfort to my doubts?".
query.result: 16 And ic ðe ðæs heowes oncniowe, 17 cwæð: "Hu mæg ic ðider cuman, gif ðu ondrædest, 18 ðe ðeah wære min hyht on ðinum hæle?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Ed elli a me: «L’angoscia de le genti 20 che son qua giù, nel viso mi dipigne 21 quella pietà che tu per tema senti.
query.error: **English:** 19 And he to me: "The anguish of the people 20 who are down here, in my face paints 21 that pity which you feel through fear.
query.result: 19 And he to me: "Þæs folces angris 20 ðe sindon her niðe, on ðam ansyne minum 21 ða mildheortnesse ðe ðu ðurh ege hæfst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Andiam, ché la via lunga ne sospigne». 23 Così si mise e così mi fé intrare 24 nel primo cerchio che l’abisso cigne.
query.error: **English:** 22 Let us go, for the long road urges us on." 23 Thus he moved, and thus he made me enter 24 into the first circle that the abyss encircles.
query.result: 22 Uton gangan, forðæm ðe ðeos lange weg us tyht." 23 Swa he hine gesette and swa he dyde ðæt ic eode 24 on ðone ærostan hring ðe ðone grund bewylgð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Quivi, secondo che per ascoltare, 26 non avea pianto mai che di sospiri 27 che l’aura etterna facevan tremare;
query.error: **English:** 25 There, according to what I could hear, 26 there was never any weeping, but only sighs 27 that made the eternal air tremble;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 ciò avvenia di duol sanza martìri, 29 ch’avean le turbe, ch’eran molte e grandi, 30 d’infanti e di femmine e di viri.
query.error: **English:** 28 this came from the pain without torment 29 that the crowds, which were many and great, 30 of infants and women and men had.
query.result: 28 ðæt wæs geómlic thing ða ic ðær geseah 29 ða miclan menigu, ða ðær wæron, 30 cnihtas and wif and ða wælgrimman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Lo buon maestro a me: «Tu non dimandi 32 che spiriti son questi che tu vedi? 33 Or vo’ che sappi, innanzi che più andi,
query.error: **English:** 31 The good master said to me: "Do you not ask 32 what spirits these are that you see? 33 Now I want you to know, before you go any further,
query.result: 31 Se goda lareow to me: "Þu ne axast 32 hwylce gastas synd þas þe þu gesyhst? 33 Nu ic wille ðæt þu wite, ær þu firr ga,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 ch’ei non peccaro; e s’elli hanno mercedi, 35 non basta, perché non ebber battesmo, 36 ch’è porta de la fede che tu credi;
query.error: **English:** 34 that they did not sin; and if they have mercy, 35 it is not enough, because they did not receive baptism, 36 which is the gate of the faith that you believe in;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 e s’e’ furon dinanzi al cristianesmo, 38 non adorar debitamente a Dio: 39 e di questi cotai son io medesmo.
query.error: **English:** 37 and if they were before Christianity, 38 they did not worship God properly: 39 and I myself am one of these.
query.result: 37 and gif hi wæron ær ðam Cristendome, 38 hi ne wurðodon God swa swa hi sceoldon: 39 and ic sylf eom an of ðam ilcan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Per tai difetti, non per altro rio, 41 semo perduti, e sol di tanto offesi 42 che sanza speme vivemo in disio».
query.error: **English:** 40 For these defects, not for any other evil, 41 we are lost, and only so much offended 42 that without hope we live in desire.
query.result: 40 For ðam gebrece, na for ðam oðrum leahtrum, 41 we synt forlorene, and swa ðeah ðæs geswencte, 42 ðæt we butan hyhte libbað on ðam gewilnungum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Gran duol mi prese al cor quando lo ’ntesi, 44 però che gente di molto valore 45 conobbi che ’n quel limbo eran sospesi.
query.error: **English:** 43 Great sorrow seized my heart when I heard it, 44 because I knew that people of great worth 45 were suspended in that limbo.
query.result: 43 Mearc sorgum wæs ða ða ic ðæt gehørde, 44 forðæm ic ðær geseah ða mænige men 45 ðe wæron on ðam wíte gebunden.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 «Dimmi, maestro mio, dimmi, segnore», 47 comincia’ io per voler esser certo 48 di quella fede che vince ogne errore:
query.error: **English:** 46 "Tell me, my master, tell me, my lord," 47 I began, wanting to be certain 48 of that faith which conquers all error:
query.result: 46 "Saga me, lareow min, saga me, hlaford," 47 ongan ic ða sprecan, willende beon georn, 48 ðære geleafan ðe ofercuman mæg æghwylcne gedwolan:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 «uscicci mai alcuno, o per suo merto 50 o per altrui, che poi fosse beato?». 51 E quei che ’ntese il mio parlar coverto,
query.error: **English:** 49 "Did anyone ever escape from here, either through his own merit 50 or through someone else's, who was then blessed?" 51 And he who understood my hidden speech,
query.result: 49 "Wæs her æfre ænig monna, ðurh his agen ðing 50 oððe ðurh oðres mannes, ðe wære siððan eadig?" 51 And se ðe ðæt gehørde ðæt ic ðus dyde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 rispuose: «Io era nuovo in questo stato, 53 quando ci vidi venire un possente, 54 con segno di vittoria coronato.
query.error: **English:** 52 replied: "I was new in this state, 53 when I saw a mighty one come here, 54 crowned with a sign of victory.
query.result: 52 he andswarode: "Ic wæs niwe on ðissum stade, 53 ða ic ðær geseah cuman ðone micclan, 54 mid sigetacne getrymede.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Trasseci l’ombra del primo parente, 56 d’Abèl suo figlio e quella di Noè, 57 di Moïsè legista e ubidente;
query.error: **English:** 55 I drew forth the shade of our first parent, 56 of his son Abel, and of Noah, 57 of Moses, the lawgiver and obedient;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Abraàm patrïarca e Davìd re, 59 Israèl con lo padre e co’ suoi nati 60 e con Rachele, per cui tanto fé,
query.error: **English:** 58 of the patriarch Abraham and King David, 59 of Israel with his father and his children, 60 and with Rachel, for whom he did so much,
query.result: 58 Abraham ðæs heahfæderes and Dauides ðæs cyninges, 59 Israhel mid his fæder and mid his bearnum 60 and mid Rachele, ðe he ða swiðe lufode,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 e altri molti, e feceli beati. 62 E vo’ che sappi che, dinanzi ad essi, 63 spiriti umani non eran salvati».
query.error: **English:** 61 and many others, and made them blessed. 62 And you should know that, before them, 63 no human spirits were saved."
query.result: 61 and fela oðre, and geworhte ða eadige. 62 And ðu scealt witan ðæt, ær ðæm, 63 nænigra manna sawla næron gehealdene."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Non lasciavam l’andar perch’ ei dicessi, 65 ma passavam la selva tuttavia, 66 la selva, dico, di spiriti spessi.
query.error: **English:** 64 We did not stop walking because he said this, 65 but we continued through the forest, 66 the forest, I say, of thick spirits.
query.result: 64 Ne forleton we ðone gang for ðæm ðe he ðis sæde, 65 ac we ferdon ða ðurh ðone wudu forð, 66 ðone wudu, ic secge, ðara ðiccena gasta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Non era lunga ancor la nostra via 68 di qua dal sonno, quand’ io vidi un foco 69 ch’emisperio di tenebre vincia.
query.error: **English:** 67 Our way was not long from there 68 beyond sleep, when I saw a fire 69 that conquered a hemisphere of darkness.
query.result: 67 Nis ðæs færes fela 68 fram ðam slæpe, ða ic ðone leoman geseah 69 ðe ðone hæðenan heofon oferwlat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Di lungi n’eravamo ancora un poco, 71 ma non sì ch’io non discernessi in parte 72 ch’orrevol gente possedea quel loco.
query.error: **English:** 70 We were still a little way off, 71 but not so far that I could not make out in part 72 that a rebellious people possessed that place.
query.result: 70 We wæron ða furðum sum fæc 71 ac ðeah ne wæs ðæt feor swa ðeah 72 ðæt ic ne gesawe ðær on sumre wisan

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 «O tu ch’onori scïenzïa e arte, 74 questi chi son c’hanno cotanta onranza, 75 che dal modo de li altri li diparte?».
query.error: **English:** 73 "O you who honor knowledge and art, 74 who are these who have such great honor, 75 that it sets them apart from the others?"
query.result: 73 "Eala ðu ðe weorðast wisdom and cræft, 74 hwa sind ðas ðe habbað swylce micelne wurðmynt, 75 ðæt hit hi fram oðrum mannum todæleð?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 E quelli a me: «L’onrata nominanza 77 che di lor suona sù ne la tua vita, 78 grazïa acquista in ciel che sì li avanza».
query.error: **English:** 76 And those to me: "The honored fame 77 that resounds of them up there in your life 78 acquires grace in heaven that so advances them."
query.result: 76 And ða to me: "Ðæt arwurðe lof 77 ðe of heom scyneð upp on ðinum life, 78 geearnað on heofonum ða gyfe ðe heom swa fremmeð."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Intanto voce fu per me udita: 80 «Onorate l’altissimo poeta; 81 l’ombra sua torna, ch’era dipartita».
query.error: **English:** 79 In the meantime, a voice was heard by me: 80 "Honor the most high poet; 81 his shade returns, which had departed".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Poi che la voce fu restata e queta, 83 vidi quattro grand’ ombre a noi venire: 84 sembianz’ avevan né trista né lieta.
query.error: **English:** 82 After the voice had ceased and was quiet, 83 I saw four great shades coming towards us: 84 their appearance was neither sad nor happy.
query.result: 82 Þa ða ða stefn wæs gestilled and gewunnen, 83 ða geseah ic feower micle sceadu to usweard cuman: 84 hiwum hi ne wæron ne sarige ne blide.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Lo buon maestro cominciò a dire: 86 «Mira colui con quella spada in mano, 87 che vien dinanzi ai tre sì come sire:
query.error: **English:** 85 The good master began to say: 86 "Look at the one with that sword in his hand, 87 who comes before the three like a lord:
query.result: 85 Se goda lareow ongan ða secgan: 86 "Loca ðone ðe ða sweord hafað on handa, 87 ðe ðam ðrim beforan gæð swa swa hlaford:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Però che ciascun meco si convene 92 nel nome che sonò la voce sola, 93 fannomi onore, e di ciò fanno bene».
query.error: **English:** 91 Because each one of them agrees with me 92 in the name that the solitary voice resounded, 93 they do me honor, and they do well in that.
query.result: 91 Forðæm ðe ælc mid me geþafað 92 on ðam naman ðe ðæt ænlipige stefn hlynode, 93 ða doð hi me arwurðnesse, and ðæt hi wel doð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Così vid’ i’ adunar la bella scola 95 di quel segnor de l’altissimo canto 96 che sovra li altri com’ aquila vola.
query.error: **English:** 94 Thus I saw the fair school assemble 95 of that lord of the loftiest song 96 who soars above the others like an eagle.
query.result: 94 Þus ic ða geseah ða fægran scolu 95 ðæs hlafordes ðæs hehstan sangas 96 se ðe ofer ða oðre swa earn fleogeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Da ch’ebber ragionato insieme alquanto, 98 volsersi a me con salutevol cenno, 99 e ’l mio maestro sorrise di tanto;
query.error: **English:** 97 After they had reasoned together for a while, 98 they turned to me with a respectful gesture, 99 and my master smiled at this;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 e più d’onore ancora assai mi fenno, 101 ch’e’ sì mi fecer de la loro schiera, 102 sì ch’io fui sesto tra cotanto senno.
query.error: **English:** 100 and they did me even greater honor, 101 for they made me one of their company, 102 so that I was sixth among such great wisdom.
query.result: 100 and magenes ma eac ða gyt seldon, 101 ða hie me dydon on heora gedryht, 102 swa ðæt ic wæs se sixta betwux ðam miclan snyttro.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Così andammo infino a la lumera, 104 parlando cose che ’l tacere è bello, 105 sì com’ era ’l parlar colà dov’ era.
query.error: **English:** 103 Thus we went on until we reached the light, 104 speaking of things that it is good to keep silent about, 105 just as it was good to speak of them where we were.
query.result: 103 Þus we eodon forð oð ðæt we comon to ðære leohte, 104 sprecende ðinga ðe ðæt dysig is to secganne, 105 swa swa hit wæs ðær to sprecanne ðær hit wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Venimmo al piè d’un nobile castello, 107 sette volte cerchiato d’alte mura, 108 difeso intorno d’un bel fiumicello.
query.error: **English:** 106 We came to the foot of a noble castle, 107 circled seven times by high walls, 108 defended all around by a beautiful stream.
query.result: 106 We comon ða to ðæs eadigan castles fót, 107 seofon siðon utan ymbefangen mid heán wealle, 108 utan ymbehworfen mid ðære fægran ea.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Questo passammo come terra dura; 110 per sette porte intrai con questi savi: 111 giugnemmo in prato di fresca verdura.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Genti v’eran con occhi tardi e gravi, 113 di grande autorità ne’ lor sembianti: 114 parlavan rado, con voci soavi.
query.error: **English:** 112 There were noble ones with slow and serious eyes, 113 of great authority in their appearance: 114 they spoke seldom, with gentle voices.
query.result: 112 Þær wæron men mid eagum dimmum and hefigum, 113 micelre anwealde on heora andwlitum: 114 spræcon seldan, mid stemnum luflicum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Traemmoci così da l’un de’ canti, 116 in loco aperto, luminoso e alto, 117 sì che veder si potien tutti quanti.
query.error: **English:** 115 We thus emerged from one of the banks, 116 into an open, bright, and lofty place, 117 so that we could see all of them.
query.result: 115 Þa comon we þus of ðam anan sidan, 116 on opene stowe, leoht and heah, 117 swa ðæt we mihton ealle ymb utan geseon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Colà diritto, sovra ’l verde smalto, 119 mi fuor mostrati li spiriti magni, 120 che del vedere in me stesso m’essalto.
query.error: **English:** 118 There, straight ahead, upon the verdant enamel, 119 the great spirits were shown to me, 120 which exalts me in my own sight to have seen them.
query.result: 118 Þær, rihte beforan, ofer ðone grene smæl, 119 wæron me gecyðede ða miclan gastas, 120 ðe ðæs gesyhðe on me selfum me up ahefð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 I’ vidi Eletra con molti compagni, 122 tra ’ quai conobbi Ettòr ed Enea, 123 Cesare armato con li occhi grifagni.
query.error: **English:** 121 I saw Electra with many companions, 122 among whom I recognized Hector and Aeneas, 123 Caesar armed with his piercing eyes.
query.result: 121 Ic geseah Eledtran mid manegum geferum, 122 betwux ðam ic oncneow Hæðnum and Ænean, 123 Casere gewæpnedne mid his grymmum eagum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Vidi Cammilla e la Pantasilea; 125 da l’altra parte vidi ’l re Latino 126 che con Lavina sua figlia sedea.
query.error: **English:** 124 I saw Camilla and Penthesilea; 125 on the other side I saw King Latinus 126 who sat with his daughter Lavinia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Vidi quel Bruto che cacciò Tarquino, 128 Lucrezia, Iulia, Marzïa e Corniglia; 129 e solo, in parte, vidi ’l Saladino.
query.error: **English:** 127 I saw that Brutus who drove out Tarquin, 128 Lucretia, Julia, Marcia, and Cornelia; 129 and by himself, somewhat apart, I saw Saladin.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Poi ch’innalzai un poco più le ciglia, 131 vidi ’l maestro di color che sanno 132 seder tra filosofica famiglia.
query.error: **English:** 130 Then, when I raised my eyes a little higher, 131 I saw the master of those who know, 132 sitting among a family of philosophers.
query.result: 130 Þa ic ða heafod up ahof, 131 ða geseah ic ðone lareow ðara ðe cunnon, 132 sittan betwux ðara witegena heap.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Tutti lo miran, tutti onor li fanno: 134 quivi vid’ ïo Socrate e Platone, 135 che ’nnanzi a li altri più presso li stanno;
query.error: **English:** 133 All look at him, all do him honor: 134 there I saw Socrates and Plato, 135 who stand before the others, closer to him;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Democrito che ’l mondo a caso pone, 137 Dïogenès, Anassagora e Tale, 138 Empedoclès, Eraclito e Zenone;
query.error: **English:** 136 Democritus, who posits that the world is random, 137 Diogenes, Anaxagoras, and Thales, 138 Empedocles, Heraclitus, and Zeno;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 e vidi il buono accoglitor del quale, 140 Dïascoride dico; e vidi Orfeo, 141 Tulïo e Lino e Seneca morale;
query.error: **English:** 139 and I saw the good collector of whom, 140 I say Dioscorides; and I saw Orpheus, 141 Tully and Linus and Seneca the moralist;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Euclide geomètra e Tolomeo, 143 Ipocràte, Avicenna e Galïeno, 144 Averoìs, che ’l gran comento feo.
query.error: **English:** 142 Euclid the geometer and Ptolemy, 143 Hippocrates, Avicenna, and Galen, 144 Averroës, who made the great commentary.
query.result: 142 Euclides ðone geometram and Ptolomaeus, 143 Hippocrates, Avicenna and Galen, 144 Averroës, ðe ðone miclan andgit ðe worhte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 Io non posso ritrar di tutti a pieno, 146 però che sì mi caccia il lungo tema, 147 che molte volte al fatto il dir vien meno.
query.error: **English:** 145 I cannot recount all of them in full, 146 because the long subject matter so presses me, 147 that often the words fail to keep up with the events.
query.result: 145 Ic ne mæg asecgan ealle be ðam ful, 146 forðæm ðe me ðæt lange weorc swiðe drefð, 147 ðæt oft ðæt word ðam weorce bið to læt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 La sesta compagnia in due si scema: 149 per altra via mi mena il savio duca, 150 fuor de la queta, ne l’aura che trema.
query.error: **English:** 148 The sixth company divides itself into two: 149 by another way the wise leader leads me, 150 out of the quiet, into the trembling air.
query.result: 148 Seoxta gefylce on twa todæleð: 149 ðurh oðerne weg me ðe wisa lædeð, 150 of ðære reste, on ða beofiende lyft.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
151 E vegno in parte ove non è che luca.
query.error: **English:** 151 And I come to a place where there is no light.
query.result: 151 And ic cume to ðære stowe ðær nis nan leoht.
